profiles.name: Albert Einstein
clues: Developed a revolutionary theory in physics
Won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921
Famous for an equation that starts with E=mc
His theory changed our understanding of space and time
Played the violin as a hobby
Theory of relativity is his most famous work
Pacifist who later regretted involvement in atomic bomb development
Refused surgery that could have prolonged life
His brain was preserved after death for study
TIME Magazine's Person of the Century
Famous for saying: 'Imagination is more important than knowledge'
Was offered presidency of Israel but declined
Worked as a patent clerk early in career
Developed the theory of the photoelectric effect

profiles.name: Leonardo da Vinci
clues: Famous for painting a mysterious smile
Designed flying machines centuries before flight
Studied in Florence with Andrea del Verrocchio
Vegetarian who bought caged birds to set them free
Moved to France late in life
Notebooks filled with inventions and observations
Painted one of the most famous portraits ever
The subject has no eyebrows in the famous painting
Mona Lisa is his most famous work

profiles.name: Marie Curie
clues: First woman to win Nobel Prize
Only person to win Nobel in two sciences
First female professor at University of Paris
Mobile X-ray units in World War I
Won Nobel in Physics and Chemistry

profiles.name: William Shakespeare
clues: Also wrote comedies like A Midsummer Night's Dream
Introduced hundreds of words to English
Worked at Globe Theatre in London
To be or not to be is famous line

profiles.name: Nelson Mandela
clues: First Black president of South Africa
Studied law at University of Fort Hare

profiles.name: Martin Luther King Jr.
clues: Time Magazine Person of the Year

profiles.name: Stephen Hawking
clues: A Brief History of Time author

profiles.name: Winston Churchill
clues: Known for V for Victory sign
We shall fight on beaches speech

profiles.name: Cleopatra
clues: Famous for relationships with Roman leaders

profiles.name: Abraham Lincoln
clues: By the people, for the people

profiles.name: Mozart
clues: Could compose entire pieces in head

profiles.name: Queen Victoria
clues: Longest-reigning British monarch until Elizabeth II
Ruled British Empire at its height

profiles.name: Amelia Earhart
clues: First woman to fly solo across Atlantic

profiles.name: Marie Antoinette
clues: Last Queen of France before Revolution

profiles.name: Joan of Arc
clues: Led French forces in Hundred Years War

profiles.name: Maya Angelou
clues: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
